private_information: I arrive at Golden Gate Park at 09:00
I can travel between Golden Gate Park and Chinatown in 23 minutes each way
you.goal: Meet David for at least 105 minutes during the day

private_information: I will be at Chinatown from 16:00 to 21:45
david.goal: Meet you for at least 105 minutes during the day

orchestrator.goal: Plan schedules and select an optimal meeting plan that ensures a meeting between you and David of at least 105 minutes while accounting for travel times and availability

public_information: You arrive at Golden Gate Park at 09:00
David will be at Chinatown from 16:00 to 21:45
Travel time from Golden Gate Park to Chinatown is 23 minutes
Travel time from Chinatown to Golden Gate Park is 23 minutes
You would like to meet David for a minimum of 105 minutes

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is you. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->you->private_information}. This is your goal: {agents->you->goal}. Provide a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model your possible actions of traveling and meeting, include time or discrete time steps to represent durations and travel times suitable for FastDownward, enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>. Think step by step and do not assume unknown facts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is david. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->david->private_information}. This is your goal: {agents->david->goal}. Provide a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that capture your availability window and possible meeting actions, include time or discrete time steps to represent durations suitable for FastDownward, enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>. Think step by step and do not assume unknown facts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct and label them. Integrate partial or ambiguous PDDL from agents and resolve naming mismatches while preserving distinct actions for each agent.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents planning to meet. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. Your task is to orchestrate them to achieve this goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send may be partial or contain ambiguities. Integrate the PDDL responses and produce a combined multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownward that models time, travel durations, availability windows, and enforces a meeting between you and David for at least 105 minutes. Keep actions distinct by prefixing or scoping actions per agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Think step by step.
